articles.author: Scott Neuman
articles.title: Shops In The UK Could Ditch The Metric System Under A New Proposal - NPR
articles.description: Boris Johnson's government is eyeing a move to allow shop stalls and supermarkets to use only imperial units of measure in all transactions, ditching a European Union requirement for metric.
articles.content:
A uniformed member of staff wearing a face covering sorts through fresh produce in British supermarket chain Morrisons last month in Leeds, United Kingdom.

articles.title: Ozone layer: Hole that develops annually is 'rather larger than usual' this year, scientists say - Daily Mail
articles.description: Following an average start this year, the hole has grown considerably in the last week, the European Union's Copernicus Atmosphere Monitoring Service said.
articles.content:
